description: This supple studded leather armor is reinforced with thin, leaf-shaped rivets of green-bronze alloy. When worn, the jerkin shifts softly with the wearer’s movements, producing little more than a whisper — like wind passing through branches
effect: Light Armor. Permanent +1 AC (12 + Dex modifier +1)
lore: The Whisperleaf was first crafted by Elven wardens who guarded the old forest roads, where silence meant survival. Each suit was treated with druidic oils and riveted by hand under a new moon.
name: Whisperleaf Ward

description: A simple, sturdy round shield. Its wooden face is reinforced with an iron rim, showing minor dents and scratches from years of service. Though plain, it is reliable and easy to maneuver, perfect for foot soldiers, adventurers, or guards.
name: Hearthshield

description: A dark, ash-veined longbow etched with faint ember cracks. When its power is invoked, a brief flame runs along the arrow before fading.
effect:
Damage: 1d8 piercing - Range: 150/600 ft
Ember Spark (1/short rest): When you hit with this bow, you may deal +1d6 fire damage. You choose after the hit is confirmed.
lore: Forged in a volcanic crucible, Emberstrike once burned with living flame. Though its fire now slumbers, the bow still responds to those who prove their worth in battle.
name: Emberstrike Bow
